title: @Riot :Any statment in Meteos recent  behaviour?
body: Its already been almost a week since the incident and i found absolutely unacceptable the lack of red posts considering how high are the standards of Pro players/Streamers regarding their behaviour in game. The vacation excuse is no use anymore. Common at least a" We are aware of this and are currently looking into it" would be enough.

replies.body:
Did anybody even report him?

Just about everybody playing at that level knows who Meteos, and a lot of them know each other, too. It's a different community at Challenger level, to be sure. Challengers do shit that would appear as "trolling" to people not at their level, and I just don't think the other Challengers care that much. Meteos getting rip-roaring drunk and throwing a couple games isn't some sort of scandal. 

I mean, look at Dyrus. Dyrus has been doing an A-Z alphabetical marathon of every champ, taking them top lane. And he's NOT performing well at ALL. Feeding as Ashe or Bard top lane isn't too far removed from the shit Meteos pulled that one session, and Dyrus was sober. But who cares? It's all in good fun.

Meteos played a few games drunk and performed horribly.

Tyler1 fanboys are arguing for a perma-ban ignoring all other context.
1/27 isn't performing horribly it is called inting

Meteos got extremely drunk and fucked up a few games. Due to having unusually bad scores, people are claiming that he was intentionally feeding. While I can't read his mind, I did watch some of the offending stream, and it was clear to me that he was simply playing terribly while unable to make good decisions about smart engages etc. 

He fucked up a few games, but like I said in my other post, I'm pretty sure the actual affected players weren't especially offended.
I hope clown9 falls and Tyler1 takes over
